suggestions: 16. Third Party Beneficiaries; Assignment. The Receiving Party is executing this Agreement for the benefit of the Disclosing Party, and the Disclosing Party shall be entitled to enforce the terms hereof. Disclosing Party has the right to assign all of its rights under this Agreement to any of its affiliates or to a successor in interest to the business of the Disclosing Party, including the right to enforce this Agreement, and the Receiving Party hereby consents to such assignment. The Receiving Party shall not assign any of its rights or delegate any of its duties under this Agreement without the prior written consent of the Disclosing Party, and such assignment or delegation in violation hereof shall be void. For the avoidance of doubt, affiliates of the Receiving Party are not considered parties to this Agreement but may receive Confidential Information provided that such affiliates are bound by confidentiality obligations no less restrictive than those contained in this Agreement, and the Receiving Party shall remain fully responsible for ensuring their compliance. Unless otherwise expressly agreed in writing, affiliates of the Disclosing Party shall not be deemed parties to this Agreement or permitted to receive Confidential Information.
originalTexts: 16. Third Party Beneficiaries; Assignment. The Receiving Party is executing this Agreement for the benefit of the Disclosing Party, and the Disclosing Party shall be entitled to enforce the terms hereof. Disclosing Party has the right to assign all of its rights under this Agreement to any of its affiliates or to a successor in interest to the business of the Disclosing Party, including the right to enforce this Agreement, and the Receiving Party hereby consents to such assignment. The Receiving Party shall not assign any of its rights or delegate any of its duties under this Agreement without the prior written consent of the Disclosing Party, and such assignment or delegation in violation hereof shall be void.
